Retention of registration marks pending transfer
	For section 26(1) of the Vehicle Excise and Registration Act [1994 (c.22)](/id/ukpga/1994/22?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (retention ofregistration mark pending transfer) substitute—
	The Secretary of State may by regulations provide for—
		a person in whose name a vehicle is registered under this Act, or
		if that person so requests, another person,
			to be granted a right of retention in respect of the registration mark for thetime being assigned to the vehicle.
		(1A)In subsection (1), the reference to a right of retention is to a right,exercisable on a single occasion falling within a period prescribed byregulations made by the Secretary of State, to have the registration markassigned to some other vehicle which is registered under this Act in the nameof—
		the person to whom the right is granted, or
		some other person nominated by him in accordance with regulations made bythe Secretary of State.”
	In subsection (2) of that section—
		in paragraph (a), for “such a right (a “right of retention”)” substitute “aright of retention”;
		in paragraph (f), for “subsection (1)” substitute “subsection (1A)”.
	In section 62(1) of that Act (other definitions), in the definition of“right of retention”, for “(2)(a)” substitute “(1A)”.
Short title
	This Act may be cited as the Vehicle Registration Marks Act 2007.
